result.execSummary:
The defendant Regina Marie Heather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management and any other counseling as directed by the agent.

Pay costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 13CF21

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Regina Marie Heather in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  13CF21/motion hearing on State's motion to revoke DPA and 14CF40/arraignment.

DA Harper states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution, calling for revocation of the DPA in 13CF21 for 12 months imposed/stayed with 3 years probation and conditions of anger management and costs.  In 14CF40, on the calendar for arraignment, def will plead to count 2/resisting for 1 year probation and dismissal/read-in of counts 1 and 3.  Repeater allegation dismissed in count 2.  Def pleads no contest to the count 2, now without the repeater allegation.  Court's colloquy on plea.

Court states it will not accept the plea agreement - believes the def needs time in jail as an "object lesson" and will order 5 days jail as a condition of probation in 14CF40.  

13CF21 - Court orders sentence of 3 years probation.  12 mo jail is imposed/stayed.  As a condition of probation, def to serve 5 days in jail - no good time.  Attend, pay for, and complete anger management and pay costs.  Def now a convicted felon; must submit DNA sample and may not possess fiearms (lifetime prohibition).  The 5 days would be the only credit def would be entitled to in the event of revocation.

14CF40 - 1 year probation, concurrent.  No imposed/stayed sentence.  Same conditions except for jail time.  Anger management.  Any other counseling as set up by the agent.  Pay for, attend, and succ. complete those.  Costs.

Atty. Longacre asks for stay of the 5 days jail until after the holidays.  Court orders it to begin on or before February 7, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  However, if there is any incident reported back to the Court, the stay will stop and def will serve the five days right away.
DA, Def, and Atty. Longacre.  Matter adj. to Dec. 8 at 9.  Arraignment scheduled for 12-08-2014 at 09:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Longacre.  Formal reading of the complaint waived.  Court previously stated the possible max. penalties.  Court has advised def of right to prelim.  Atty. L states that def wishes to waive right to prelim; presents Court with completed waiver form.  Arraignment requested and set.  Arraignment scheduled for 10-29-2014 at 02:30 pm.
No acts or threats of violence.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

DA Harper and Def without counsel.  Court states the charges and informs def of her rights including right to counsel.  Def states she has contacted SPD and is eligible.  Court adjourns initial. 

As Def was summonsed in on this case, DA asks for $5000 signature bond with condition of no acts or threats of violence.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 09-17-2014 at 01:30 pm.
